channel.title: Earthquake Source on
channel.description: Recent content in Earthquake Source on

item.title: 1976 Italy Earthquake, Mag. 6.5
item.description: (We did not make this one!) From the youtube site: This is the sonorous recording of the first one shake of the Friuli’s earthquake (north Italy). A Tricesimo’s boy, Mario Garlatti, was pouring again a passage of the Pink Floyd from the turntable to the cassettes recorder. The microphone, remained on, it has recorded a dramatic sequence: the arm of the turntable that jumps, the noise provoked by the shake and the terror in the house.

item.title: Acoustic Emissions
item.description:
seismicsoundlab · 3rocks_AcousticEmissions
Acoustic emissions from three different rock types deformed in the laboratory(in MHz frequency range, slowed down to audible). Deformation experiments: Alexandre Schubnel’s lab, ENS Paris Sonification: Ben Holtzman and Arthur Paté Narration: Martin Pratt Made for the 2017 Open House at Lamont Doherty Earth Observatory, Columbia University Related Learning Units Human-induced Earthquakes and Energy
